definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by

sentences.english: The wind screamed through the woods.

sentences.chinese: 透過狂風的呼嘯和怒吼。

sentences.english: The bullet zipped past my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 子彈從我的肩頭呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: Just then, a whole flight of bombers zoomed over the house.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時，一整隊轟炸機從房子上空呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: You can hear her shout, So that there's no doubt.
sentences.chinese: 你可以聽到她的呼嘯聲，毫無疑問的，她在說。

sentences.english: A stiff wind howled from the west, thankfully warmed by the summer sun.
sentences.chinese: 冷硬的風從西邊呼嘯過來，感謝夏日的陽光溫暖着它。

sentences.english: A weather front is blowing in, and his thick wool cape flutters behind him.
sentences.chinese: 山風呼嘯，他那厚重的羊毛披肩往身後急速的擺盪。

sentences.english: Her shot went whistling past the goalpost .
sentences.chinese: 她的射門呼嘯着越過球門柱。

sentences.english: Heathcliff overhears and runs away from Wuthering Heights. Ch 9
sentences.chinese: 希斯克裏夫無意間聽到，於是從呼嘯山莊離家出走。

sentences.english: Heathcliff was the well-known revenger in the novel Wuthering Heights written by Emily Bronte.
sentences.chinese: 勃郎特小說《呼嘯山莊》中衆所周知的一位復仇者。

sentences.english: The wind howled through the woods.
The siren wailed piercingly in the cold morning air.
sentences.chinese: 警報器在早晨的冷空氣裏尖厲地呼嘯著。

sentences.english: I am in a thousand winds that blow, Across northreands azeroth.
sentences.chinese: 我是萬千呼嘯的風，飛過白雪皚皚的艾澤拉斯。

sentences.english: Reluctantly, Ellen agrees to accompany her to Wuthering Heights the next day.
sentences.chinese: 艾倫不情願地答應第二天陪小凱西去呼嘯山莊。

definition: lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
